intro: Scleranthus comosus, commonly known as the common thornweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in various parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red. Scleranthus comosus is adapted to thrive in dry conditions and is often found along roadsides and in open fields.
